properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 8 at 11:14AM PST until January 9 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Eureka CA
properties.description:
* WHAT...Snowfall in excess of 3 to 6 inches expected above 3500
feet. Locally higher amounts in the Trinity Alps.

* WHERE...Northern Trinity County.

* WHEN...From 10 PM this evening to 10 AM PST Thursday.

* IMPACTS...The hazardous conditions could impact the Thursday
morning commute. Chains or snow tires may be needed over Scott
Mountain Summit.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Hazardous travel conditions are expected
across Scott Mountain Summit on Highway 3. Some minor amounts of
1 to 3 inches are possible along the highest portions of
Highway 36 to the east of South Fork Mountain.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

The latest road conditions for the state of California can be
obtained by calling 1-800-GAS-ROAD.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 10 PM THIS EVENING TO 10 AM PST THURSDAY ABOVE 3500 FEET
